intro: Pseudabutilon paniculatum, commonly known as the paniculate pseudabutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in terminal panicles. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a soft, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
